name: Synth
description:
Synths are the fundamental units of your generative model.

Each Synth represents a preferred future sensory-state — an observation you want to see in the world when that part of your system is fulfilled.
There are no tasks or to-dos in this system.

Only Synths, identical in structure but different in Horizon:
• Becoming — hyperprior
• Vision — long-range preferred observations
• Goal — major intermediate preferred observations
• Project — bundled policies
• Action — immediate control signals

Synths form a fractal hierarchy: every Synth (except Becoming) must support a parent Synth.

Your role is to update the world so that evidence aligns with your preferred observations — one Synth at a time.
